name: Carrot Halwa (Gajar Ka Halwa)
history: Carrot Halwa, also known as Gajar Ka Halwa, is a classic Indian dessert made with carrots. Originating from the northern regions of India, it has become a beloved treat in Indian cuisine.
description: Carrot Halwa is a rich and sweet dessert made from grated carrots, milk, sugar, and ghee. It's often flavored with cardamom and garnished with nuts, making it a delightful treat especially in winter.

instructions.title: Cook Carrots in Milk
instructions.description: In a heavy bottomed pan, combine grated carrots and milk. Cook over medium heat, stirring frequently, until the milk is completely absorbed.

instructions.title: Add Sugar and Ghee
instructions.description: Once the milk is absorbed, add sugar and ghee to the carrot mixture. Cook until the mixture thickens.

instructions.title: Add Flavorings and Nuts
instructions.description: Stir in cardamom powder. Add chopped almonds, cashews, and raisins. Mix well.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Carrot Halwa hot or at room temperature. It can also be served cold.

tips: Continuously stir the carrots while cooking to prevent sticking and ensure even cooking.
Adjust the amount of sugar according to your preference.
variations: Vegan Carrot Halwa: Use plant-based milk and oil instead of dairy milk and ghee.
Carrot Halwa with Khoya: Add khoya (milk solid) for a richer texture.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 5 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat in a microwave or on the stove with a little milk to prevent drying out.
presentationTips: Garnish with more chopped nuts and a sprinkle of cardamom powder before serving.
Serve in a decorative bowl or as part of a thali (platter).
